meanings.definition: Side by side and facing the same way.
meanings.sent1: The two friends walked abreast along the path.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marched abreast in perfect formation.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled abreast, looking like a cute parade.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized swimmers moved abreast like a graceful wave.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flags fluttered abreast in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Up to date with the latest news or information.
meanings.sent1: She made sure to stay abreast of all the current trends.
meanings.sent2: Being abreast of market changes is crucial for success.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed abreast of the gossip in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: He was always abreast of the newest technology developments.
meanings.sent5: The students stayed abreast by reading the daily newspaper.
